project.teaser: SEETIP Ocean’s mission is to enhance cooperation and collaboration amongst stakeholders both inside and outside of the European ocean energy sector. This mission is broken down into 6 objectives:1. Maximise European scientific excellence in ocean energy2. Make sustainability...
project.objective: SEETIP Ocean’s mission is to enhance cooperation and collaboration amongst stakeholders both inside and outside of the European ocean energy sector. This mission is broken down into 6 objectives: 1. Maximise European scientific excellence in ocean energy 2. Make sustainability and the Just Transition an integral part of ocean energy’s development 3. Build a deeper understanding of how ocean energy can optimally fit into the wider energy, industrial & infrastructure systems and planning systems, and help realise this integration 4. Empower the SET Plan Ocean Energy Implementation Working Group and other public authorities by monitoring, analysing and reporting annual commentary on the sector’s progress 5. Reinforce and expand the ocean energy network through strong outreach actions 6. Continue the work of ETIP Ocean and SET Plan Ocean Energy IWG after the project ends Ocean energy can power European society and economic life with electricity that is renewable, dependable and in harmony with local communities and environments. To reach this potential, sectoral stakeholders must collaborate, share knowledge and avoid duplication of efforts. SEETIP Ocean will do this by supporting the activities of both the European Technology & Innovation Platform for ocean energy (ETIP Ocean) and the SET Plan Ocean Energy Implementation Working Group. The project’s objectives will be achieved through coordination actions bringing individuals and organisations together to exchange knowledge, create new knowledge and build more and deeper connections. Widespread knowledge-sharing will be facilitated via webinars and workshops. Based on these exchanges, SEETIP Ocean will publish accessible studies and reports that will be widely disseminated across and beyond the ocean energy sector. The SET Plan Ocean Energy IWG’s work will be supported with annual updated information on sector’s progress and policy and funding support. Up-to-date and accurate data will inform the IWG’s decision-making.

result.title: Report of the SET Plan IWG workshops
result.description: The report will describe the activities and outcomes from participating in the SET Plan IWG workshops.

result.title: Report on webinars and workshops
result.description: The series of webinars will produce, the following documents: Presentation slides; links to relevant external material; webinar recording; number and type of participants. Result from Task 1.1 & 1.4.

result.title: Annual report I
result.description: The first of the annual reports analysing the activity in the ocean energy sector prepared for the IWG.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SEETIP Ocean (Support to SET Plan Implementation Working Group and European Technology and Innovation Platform for Ocean Energy)
result.teaser: SEETIP Ocean’s mission is to enhance cooperation and collaboration amongst stakeholders both inside and outside of the European ocean energy sector. This mission is broken down into 6 objectives:1. Maximise European scientific excellence in ocean energy2. Make sustainability...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report of the ETIP Forum and coordination calls
result.description: The report will describe the activities and outcomes obtained from participating in 6 meetings of the ETIP Forum and quarterly coordination calls.

result.title: Annual report II
result.description: The second of the annual reports analysing the activity in the ocean energy sector.

result.title: Report on 8 consenting and environmental impact webinars & workshop
result.description: The outcomes of the 8 webinars & workshop will be prepared, with the following set of documents: presentation slides, video recording (if a virtual event) and list of type of participants.

details.authors: Pablo Ruiz-Minguela, Jose Luis Villate, Pui Wah Wong, Donald R. Noble, Henry Jeffrey
details.journalTitle: MEASURING PROGRESS TOWARDS OCEAN ENERGY COMMERCIALISATION
details.publisher: Federacion de Asociaciones de Ingenieros Industriales de Espana

result.title: ‘Best Practice’ guidelines on community engagement
result.description: This deliverable will outline community engagement best practices for the ocean energy sector

result.title: Joint report with ETIP Wind on integration of ocean energy and offshore wind
result.description: This joint report will describe the potential of ocean energy and offshore wind integration and give recommendations on how to reach the EU Offshore Renewable Energy Strategy targets.

result.title: Report on infrastructural and industrial production requirements
result.description: The report will provide an overview of the infrastructural and industrial production requirements of ocean energy to reach the EU Offshore Renewable Energy Strategy target of 1GW by 2030.

result.title: Report on the results of the joint advocacy activities on the NECP update
result.description: This deliverable will include a description of the activities and outcomes of the advocacy campaign carried out with other ETIPs on the update of the NECPs.

result.title: Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda
result.description: Report outlining the technological priority areas, objectives, actions and deployment plan to encourage the commercialisation of ocean energy in Europe. Results from Task 1.3.

result.title: Booklet on ocean energy’s integration into Europe’s electricity system
result.description: This booklet will be accessible to non-experts and will translate the latest scientific studies on how wave and tidal energy will interact with other variable renewable sources on electricity systems.

result.title: Report on the prioritisation of research, technology and innovation challenges
result.description: The prioritisation update will result in a list of key technology development requirements in the ocean energy sector. This deliverable will be used in the development of the SRIA. Result from Task 1.2.

result.title: Annual report III
result.description: The third of the annual reports analysing the activity in the ocean energy sector.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
